title: Canes head home in pursuit of title: 'Not finished'
content: Carson Beck scrambled for a 3-yard touchdown with 18 seconds left, and Miami will head back home for a shot at its first national championship since 2001 after beating Ole Miss 31-27 in an exhilarating CFP semifinal at the Fiesta Bowl.

title: Miami's Lewis encourages Lacy, resilient Rebels
content: Hurricanes great Ray Lewis pulled Ole Miss running back Kewan Lacy aside after Thursday night's CFP semifinal, offering advice that reinforced the values of a Rebels team that never quit.

title: QB Williams runs reverse, stays at Washington
content: QB Demond Williams Jr., who initially signed a big-money deal with Washington only to announce he was entering the transfer portal days later, has decided to remain with the Huskies.

title: Ravens' Monken: 'Didn't coach Lamar well enough'
content: OC Todd Monken accepted the blame for quarterback Lamar Jackson's regression in his third season in the system, telling the "Ryan Ripken Show" he "didn't coach Lamar well enough" and "didn't have as good of a relationship as I could have [with him]."

title: Wolves hold moment of silence for Renee Good
content: The Timberwolves held a moment of silence before their game Thursday night for the 37-year-old woman fatally shot in her car by an ICE officer.

title: Gold medalist Kim injured ahead of Winter Games
content: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Chloe Kim said Thursday that she dislocated a shoulder in training and her status for the Winter Games is uncertain.

title: Heat-Bulls ppd. due to condensation on court
content: The scheduled game between the Chicago Bulls and Miami Heat was postponed because of condensation on the court in Chicago on Thursday night.

title: üèÄ Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: From 'duck feet' to 'production over potential:' Curt Cignetti's secret to building Indiana
content: The Hoosiers' roster is filled with different kinds of players, but all had to meet Cignetti's standards.

title: Inside Oregon's rise as a college football blue blood
content: In a sport that often tethers itself to history and tradition, Oregon has become a unique kind of vanguard.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: WNBPA president Nneka Ogwumike and VP Napheesa Collier applaud player solidarity but bemoan a lack of progress in CBA negotiations.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's Olympic players
content: The Lightning are up to No. 2 -- and are tops in players on Olympic rosters. Here's who each team will send.

title: NFL's best QB room? How Mac Jones and Brock Purdy helped each other to the playoffs
content: San Francisco will face Philadelphia on Sunday (4:30 p.m. ET) in part because of a strong bond between the duo.

title: Our guide to the six NFL wild-card games: Matchup previews, bold predictions and X factors
content: Packers at Bears? Bryce Young's first playoff game? Justin Herbert vs. Drake Maye? We have picks, predictions and stats to know for every wild-card game.

title: The inside story of the Bears' 'Good, better, best!' craze
content: After each win, Ben Johnson leads the Bears in a chant they hope to keep alive after Saturday night's game vs. the Packers.

title: Latest NBA trade intel: What's next for Atlanta, Washington, other teams after the Trae Young deal
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Trae Young deal and what comes next for the Washington Wizards and Atlanta Hawks.

title: Offseason guide for eliminated NFL teams: Key free agents, draft outlook, priorities and predictions
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 18 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Transfer window weekly: Real Madrid open to Vin√≠cius exit? Chelsea keen?
content: The winter transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Buzz: Hoosiers-Ducks winner likely to be favorite in national championship game
content: The winner of Friday's semifinal between Indiana and Oregon is expected to be the favorite in the national title game, regardless of opponent.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Inter eye Serie A center back
content: Manchester United and Inter Milan are interested in Sassuolo defender Tarik Muharemovic. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Knueppel, Adebayo headline biggest surprises and disappointments
content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

title: Flex and superflex rankings for 2026
content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

title: 'Inaccurate': MEA rebuts Trump aide's 'PM did not call' remarks; cites 8 Modi-Trump calls in 2025
content: Ministry of external affairs has refuted US secretary of commerce Howard Lutnick's claims regarding trade deal negotiations. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that Lutnick's remarks were inaccurate, highlighting multiple rounds of talks and the closeness of a deal on several occasions. He also confirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump have spoken eight times in 2025.

title: 'Did nothing wrong': Mamata on action during ED raids; makes coal scam charge against BJP
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee defended her interference during ED's I-PAC raids, alleging the agency sought to "steal" her party's data. She accused senior BJP leaders in Delhi of receiving "coal scam proceeds" and claimed the BJP won Maharashtra by "stealing the mandate" with EC's help, aiming to do the same in Bengal.

title: Himachal: 8 dead as private bus rolls down the hill in Sirmaur - video
content: A private bus carrying 30-35 passengers rolled off a hilly road in Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, killing at least eight people. The bus was traveling from Kupvi to Shimla when it lost control in the Haripurdhar area. Rescue operations are ongoing, and the death toll is feared to rise as several passengers sustained serious injuries.

title: Thirty years ago, a punt helped the country to World Cup triumph
content: To win a Cricket World Cup, all your elements ‚Äî batting, bowling and fielding ‚Äî need to collectively work well. Consistency in team efforts, along with a few individuals‚Äô standout performances, makes a team the World Champion. But sometimes a decision, technical or tactical, during the buildup to such a mega event turns out to be a trump card for the team, leading them to massive success.

title: Why RBI isn't targeting Rupee's price band ‚Äî the 'impossible trilemma' explained
content: The Indian rupee crossed Rs 90 to the dollar in early December 2025, marking its weakest level on record. Why did the RBI allow the currency to slide instead of stepping in to defend it, and why are policymakers insisting they are not worried? The answers lie in a hard economic constraint that leaves central banks with fewer choices than they appear to have.

title: Google cofounders Sergey Brin and Larry Page are 'cutting ties' with Silicon Valley
content: Google co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have moved a key entity out of California to Delaware, ahead of a potential 5% wealth tax. This move, with Reno, Nevada listed as the principal office, comes as the state considers a retroactive tax on billionaires.

title: Israel‚ÄìHezbollah tensions: Tel Aviv launches fresh strikes across Lebanon
content: Israel launched air strikes on Hezbollah sites in Lebanon, targeting weapons facilities and production sites. This follows Lebanon's announcement of disarming the group in the south. While Israel deems the Lebanese army's efforts an encouraging start, it insists full disarmament is necessary, citing ongoing Hezbollah rearmament as a threat.

title: Musk impressed with China, says 'Does things I say'; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk noted China's rapid adoption of electric vehicles, batteries, and solar power, mirroring his suggestions. He emphasized batteries as key to boosting US energy output without new power plants. Tesla's Megapacks and Megablock offer utility-scale storage solutions. Musk also warned of potential silver price hikes due to Chinese export restrictions.

title: How a simple school prayer turned 23-year-old teacher from Bihar into an internet star
content: A Gaya teacher's simple morning prayer rendition of a Bhagavad Gita shloka unexpectedly went viral, touching millions. Shalini Singh, who uses music to impart wisdom to her students, found her lifelong passion recognized. Her journey, supported by family and school, highlights faith, perseverance, and the meaningful impact of sincere dedication.

title: 'Hands of US president stained with blood': Khamenei says 'arrogant' Trump will be overthrown
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a stern warning to protesters, vowing the Islamic Republic would back down to the unrest and further accused foreign-backed elements of seeking to destabilize the nation.  Amidst a communications blackout, demonstrations over soaring inflation have escalated, with rights groups reporting dozens killed and thousands detained.

title: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan replies to Donald Trump‚Äôs post on ‚ÄòMade in America‚Äô chips
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan lauded President Trump's support for 'Make in America' initiatives.  The company unveiled its first sub-2 nanometer CPU processors, designed, built, and packaged entirely within the US.  These advanced Core Ultra Series 3 chips, featuring powerful AI capabilities, are set to revolutionize consumer laptops, with shipments beginning soon.

title: ‚ÄòRemoved from reality‚Äô: SC pushes back on Sharmila Tagore's plea in stray dogs case
content: The Supreme Court continues hearing pleas on stray dog management. Actor Sharmila Tagore's counsel argued for science-based solutions. Lawyers debated the Animal Birth Control rules and identifying aggressive dogs. The court cautioned against romanticizing dogs in hospitals. Suggestions for identification were raised. Welfare groups stressed proper rule enforcement. The court considered constitutional limits and empathy in its interim order.

title: 'Cousin thought I died': Jemimah Rodrigues recalls horrific 'church' incident
content: Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues recalled a scary childhood incident where she fell from the first floor during a church programme while playing with cousins, making them think she had died. Luckily unharmed, the story is now a fond memory. Today, Jemimah is a World Cup hero and the newly appointed Delhi Capitals captain.

title: Air pollution crisis: 44% Indian cities face chronic PM2.5 levels; NCAP covers just 4%
content: A new analysis reveals nearly half of Indian cities grapple with chronic air pollution, a persistent issue stemming from ongoing emission sources.  The National Clean Air Programme currently covers only a fraction of these severely affected urban areas, highlighting a significant gap in addressing the crisis.  Experts urge targeted reforms and a broader approach to combat this widespread problem.

title: Fans melt over Karl-Anthony Towns and Jordyn Woods‚Äô custom engagement cards
content: New York Knicks star Karl-Anthony Towns proposed to Jordyn Woods on Christmas. The couple announced their engagement on Instagram. Custom trading cards celebrating their proposal were revealed, drawing warm fan reactions. Towns also shared details about the engagement ring's meaning. Their relationship has overcome significant challenges, including the loss of Towns' mother.

title: Mamata hits the streets: Bengal CM leads Kolkata rally against ED raids on I-PAC; watch
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a protest in Kolkata against the Enforcement Directorate's raids on I-PAC, accusing the central agency of attempting to access TMC's internal data. The party claims the ED's actions are politically motivated to intimidate opposition. Similar protests occurred in Delhi, with TMC MPs detained.

title: ‚ÄòHug hug na raha‚Äô: Congress takes dig at PM Modi over stalled India‚ÄìUS trade deal
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised the BJP-led Centre, citing US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick's comments that India missed a trade deal with the US due to a lack of direct leadership engagement. Lutnick claimed Prime Minister Modi did not personally call then-President Trump, stalling advanced negotiations. The US subsequently finalized deals with other regional countries.

title: Why has Sensex plunged over 2,100 points, Nifty down over 2%? Top 5 reasons explained
content: Stock market crash: Indian equities extended their slide to a fifth straight session on Friday as global trade worries and political uncertainty drove a broad selloff, several lakh crore in market cap.

title: Mustafizur row: Sponsors pull back, futures clouded ‚Äî B'desh cricketers in limbo
content: Bangladesh cricket faces uncertainty as Indian sponsorship deals for players like Litton Das are at risk following the Mustafizur Rahman controversy. The Bangladesh Cricket Board has requested the International Cricket Council shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka due to security concerns, impacting players and coaching staff.

title: 'Commotion in courtroom': Calcutta HC adjourns ED plea seeking FIR against Mamata
content: The Calcutta High Court adjourned a hearing on the ED's plea for an FIR against Mamata Banerjee amid courtroom chaos. The TMC had moved the court against ED raids on I-PAC, alleging seizure of sensitive political data intended for upcoming elections. The ED countered, accusing Banerjee of obstructing the probe into a coal scam.

title: ‚ÄòSwings like a wild pendulum‚Äô: Kharge targets Modi govt‚Äôs foreign policy
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticised the Modi government's foreign policy, citing alleged inconsistency and compromise of India's strategic interests. He pointed to the potential lifting of bans on Chinese companies for government contracts and PM Modi's silence on US President Donald Trump's comments regarding India's Russian oil purchases.

title: Radicalisation alarm: Why UAE is losing faith in UK universities
content: The UAE has restricted government scholarships for Emirati students to study in the UK, citing concerns over Islamist radicalisation, particularly linked to the Muslim Brotherhood. While private enrolment remains possible, UK degrees may not be recognised domestically. This policy has sharply reduced Emirati student numbers, reflecting broader diplomatic strains between the UAE and UK, despite ongoing British university campuses in Dubai.

title: Bricks, stones and iron rods: 35-year-old woman beaten to death by neighbours
content: A 35-year-old woman was beaten to death and four others injured in Bihar's Nawada district following a dispute over alleged witchcraft. Tensions flared when a neighbor's child fell ill, leading to accusations against the deceased woman. Her family claims relatives from the neighboring family attacked her with bricks, stones, and iron rods.

title: Why bhajan jamming is more than just a trend
content: Devotion is evolving, with Bhajan Jamming emerging as a popular, modern expression of spirituality. This trend, embraced by younger generations, blends traditional chants with contemporary music, fostering community and inner calm. Experts believe this participatory approach offers a relatable, impactful way to connect with faith, suggesting it's more than a fleeting fad.

title: 1 USD = 1,400,000 IRR: Iran on edge - why this is the most dangerous uprising yet
content: Iran's latest protests, sparked by a devastating economic collapse and a plummeting currency, are unlike previous unrest. This wave sees a broader social coalition, including merchants, demanding regime change. Unlike past uprisings, the trigger is not a single outrage but the daily futility of a broken economy, making this a critical legitimacy crisis for Tehran.

title: 36 missiles, 242 drones: 4 killed in Russia's bombings in Ukraine; Nato border rattles
content: Russia launched a massive overnight strike on Ukraine, using hypersonic missiles and drones, causing significant damage and casualties in Kyiv. The attack, which hit residential buildings and even the Qatar Embassy, was reportedly a retaliation for a prior drone incident. Meanwhile, Ukraine targeted Russia's Belgorod region, disrupting power and heating for over half a million people.

title: Trump says he has never taken the 'fat drug' Ozempic, but this White House official has...
content: President Donald Trump told The New York Times he has not used GLP-1 weight-loss drugs like Ozempic or Wegovy but joked he ‚Äúprobably should.‚Äù The disclosure comes as these medications spark debates over healthcare costs and insurance coverage. Trump‚Äôs remarks highlight both his personal health and his administration‚Äôs policies aimed at lowering drug prices, showing the drugs‚Äô growing political and cultural relevance.

title: Gold rate today: How much of 22K, 24K gold cost in your city; check rates
content: Gold futures saw a slight increase on Friday morning, despite a generally weak market tone influenced by a stronger US dollar and commodity index adjustments. Traders are awaiting US non-farm payrolls data for further price direction. Spot gold experienced a dip overseas, while US gold futures edged higher.

title: Jason Kelce explains why he trusts Eagles to beat 49ers in playoff opener
content: Jason Kelce believes the Eagles have what it takes to beat the 49ers in their Wild Card showdown, pointing to a strong run game, Jalen Hurts‚Äô mobility, and a healthy defense. While acknowledging San Francisco‚Äôs quality, Kelce says Philadelphia‚Äôs balance on both sides of the ball gives them a clear edge.

title: ED vs Mamata: On rewind mode, Didi dons street-fighter image; third time she took to streets in 10 yrs
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee demonstrated her street-fighting spirit by visiting I-PAC chief Pratik Jain's residence and office after an ED search. She alleged the agency sought party candidate lists and poll strategy documents. This move, reminiscent of past protests against central agencies, invigorated party workers and reinforced her image as a resilient leader ahead of elections.

title: BCCL IPO subscribed fully within minutes! Check price band, GMP, valuation & more
content: Bharat Coking Coal Ltd's IPO saw robust investor demand, fully subscribing within minutes of opening. Non-institutional and retail investors showed strong interest, with the issue already securing over Rs 273 crore from anchor investors. This offer for sale by Coal India is part of the government's divestment drive in the coal sector.

title: Tilak ruled out: 'Sarpanch sahab should be picked' - Ex-India opener backs Iyer
content: Former India opener Aakash Chopra strongly advocates for Shreyas Iyer's immediate inclusion in the T20I squad. He believes Iyer is the ideal replacement for the injured Tilak Varma, emphasising the need for middle-order stability and experience ahead of a crucial white-ball calendar. Chopra sees Iyer as the most logical choice, even over other contenders like Riyan Parag.

title: Another ceasefire violation: 13 killed as Israel strikes across Gaza
content: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 13 Palestinians, including five children, in Gaza on Thursday, despite a largely observed ceasefire. The Israeli military stated the strikes were in response to a failed rocket attack from Gaza, which they deemed a violation of the agreement. These incidents occurred as a new international body for Gaza was announced.

title: 'Death to Islamic Republic': Iran protests get angrier, buildings set on fire ‚Äî watch
content: Nationwide protests against Iran's religious dictatorship escalated with protesters setting fire to government buildings, prompting the government to cut off internet and international phone services. Violence has resulted in at least 42 deaths and over 2,270 detentions, as economic grievances fuel broader anti-government demonstrations.

title: 'Decisions will echo for 10 yrs': Ex-captain Tamim Iqbal warns B'desh over T20 WC call
content: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal urged the BCB to carefully consider the national team's T20 World Cup participation, warning against hasty decisions driven by public emotion. He emphasized prioritizing Bangladesh cricket's long-term future and suggested dialogue over public pronouncements. Iqbal stressed the BCB's need for independent decision-making while acknowledging government involvement.

title: Suicide at Delhi's Saket Court: Staffer jumps from building; probe under way
content: A court staff member, Harish, tragically died by suicide at Saket court complex, reportedly due to overwhelming work pressure. A recovered suicide note cited immense workload, physical disability challenges, and anxiety as contributing factors. Lawyers and staff are protesting, demanding justice for Harish, whose note detailed his struggles with job demands and financial concerns.

title: Gujarat horror: 14-year-old girl abducted, gangraped by 8; stepped out to answer nature‚Äôs call
content: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped by eight individuals, including a minor, in Navsari district. The accused, aged 16 to 21, were arrested after the survivor revealed the incident to her parents. The girl was abducted from her home and taken to a secluded location where the assault occurred.

title: Stray dogs case: SC refuses to go into allegation of harassment of women dog feeders
content: Supreme Court was hearing arguments on pleas, including the ones filed by dog lovers, seeking modification of its earlier orders and those for stringent compliance with the directives

title: Northeast tea body to confer Lifetime Achievement Award on Piyush Desai
content: The awardee is the chairman of Wagh Bakri Tea Group, which has been in the beverage business since 1892

title: Ashtamudi Lake all set for grand water regatta
content: Ashtamudi Lake in Kollam is poised for a thrilling showdown as it hosts the 11th President‚Äôs Trophy Boat Race and the grand finale of the Champions Boat League on January 10

title: Not a holiday: Government tells administrators to be there for athletes at multi-sport events
content: The Conclave was attended by Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya and along with top officials from IOA and National Sports Federations, Gujarat's Deputy Chief Minister and Sports Minister Harsh Sanghavi and Sports Secretary Hari Ranjan Rao

title: Snovasys plans to invest ‚Çπ200 crore on expansion, aims to double workforce in five years
content: Ongole-based tech company‚Äôs Workforce Intelligence platform is currently being used by more than 1,300 clients across 127 countries

title: Former cricketer held for murder of differently-abled woman in Chittoor
content: The accused reportedly had an heated argument with the victim on issue of marriage, following which the accused killed the victim, the police said

title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on two-day visit to India; to meet PM Modi in Ahmedabad on Jan. 12
content: PM Modi and the German Chancellor will visit the Sabarmati Ashram and participate in the International Kite Festival at the Sabarmati Riverfront

title: Central Forensic Science Laboratory officials inspect Karur stampede site
content: The officials studied the topography of the area and the surrounding approach roads and lanes, including the spot where Mr. Vijay addressed a massive gathering from his caravan

title: 63 Naxalites surrender in Chhattisgarh
content: They were active in South Bastar division, the West Bastar division, Maad division in the State, and in areas bordering Odisha, a senior police officer said.

title: MEA refutes U.S. Commerce Secretary statements on PM Modi not speaking to Donald Trump
content: On mandating as much as 500% in tariffs, Ministry of External Affairs said ‚ÄúWe are aware of the proposed Bill. We are closely following the developments‚Äù

title: Adapting to changing times, KSEB‚Äôs ‚ÄòModel Section Offices‚Äô to be recast as digitally-capable ‚ÄòSmart Section Offices‚Äô
content: The ‚ÄòSmart Section Offices‚Äô  concept is expected to enhance human resource utilisation, reduce losses, minimise billing and metering errors, improve revenue realisation, and strengthen the overall business efficiency of KSEB.

title: T.N. government notifies 100 reserve forests in last five years
content: The newly notified forest blocks are spread across 10 districts ‚Äî Dindigul, Dharmapuri, Madurai, Kallakurichi, Theni, Sivagangai, Namakkal, the Nilgiris, Salem, and Tenkasi

title: Strongly condemn shameful and unacceptable treatment meted out to TMC MPs, says Mamata
content: Several Trinamool Congress MPs were detained while staging protests against alleged misuse of probe agencies by the Centre

title: Standards of ethical values higher for lawyers seeking to contest bar polls: Supreme Court
content: The top court was hearing a plea of Rapolu Bhaskar, a prominent Telangana High Court advocate, assailing provisions of disqualification of an advocate in State Bar Council

title: TVK chief Vijay forms 12-member panel to draft manifesto for T.N. Assembly poll
content: He said the committee would tour Tamil Nadu to elicit opinions and views from the general public while drafting the manifesto

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: ED registers Enforcement Case Information Report under PMLA
content: All those named in the cases registered by State investigative agencies may be arraigned as accused in the ED case as well, with the possibility of more names being added as the investigation progresses

title: More than ‚Çπ34,000 crore investment made in Uttar Pradesh defence corridor nodes: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh was addressing a gathering after inaugurating Ashok Leyland's electric vehicle manufacturing plant in Lucknow

title: CID probe into Hubballi disrobing allegation after approval from CM, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: A video showing a woman, said to be a BJP worker, allegedly being disrobed went viral on social media

title: Assam Opposition files complaint against BJP over alleged voter list ‚Äòconspiracy‚Äô
content: Congress, CPI(M), Raijor Dal, Assam Jatiya Parishad, and CPI(ML)L, in a joint complaint filed at Dispur Police Station, claimed that State BJP president Dilip Saikia has specifically entrusted Cabinet Minister Ashok Singhal to carry out the deletion process in 60 LAC‚Äôs

title: India, EU hold FTA talks; reaffirm commitment to protect farmers, MSMEs
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal is on a two-day official visit to the EU headquarters for the talks

title: Survival is our politics now, says CBCI president Archbishop Mar Andrews Thazhath
content: Thrissur Archbishop questions Centre‚Äôs stance that fringe groups are responsible for attacks on Christians in North India. ‚ÄòIf so, why¬†the¬†silence? Why¬†no¬†public condemnation? Silence is not neutrality ‚Äî it is complicity, he says

title: Centre opposes in High Court plea to reduce GST on air purifiers, says judicial intervention impermissible
content: The petition filed by advocate Kapil Madan said air purifiers cannot be treated as luxury items in view of the ‚Äúextreme emergency crisis‚Äù caused by severe air pollution in Delhi

title: CHCs, PHCs in five locations in Kalaburagi upgraded
content: Among other things, the existing 30-bed Community Health Centres (CHCs) at Kalagi and Yadrami, both taluk headquarters, have been upgraded to 50-bed facilities

title: Himachal HC directs State govt to conduct elections to Panchayati Raj bodies before April 30
content: Maintaining that the State has suffered extensive damage to public and private properties and roads, the State government had urged the SEC to put the election process on hold till the situation improved on the ground

title: Daughter of former Madhya Pradesh Home Minister among three killed in road accident near Indore
content: The accident occurred near the Ralamandal area on the Tejaji Nagar bypass when a car collided with a truck, Tejaji Nagar police station in charge Devendra Markam told PTI

title: Amit Shah inaugurates national database on IED blasts
content: The platform will collect and analyse improvised explosive device data gathered from across the country and disseminate it to security agencies

title: Kerala CM acting to fulfil PM Modi‚Äôs wishes, alleges Ramesh Chennithala
content: Chennithala describes CPI(M) and BJP as ‚Äòallies‚Äô, claiming that ‚ÄòBJP makes statements on behalf of the Chief Minister and vice versa‚Äô

title: Pune film fest: First internationally co-produced Assamese film chosen
content: An India-Israel project, ‚ÄòMurder Too Close ‚Äì Love Too Far‚Äô has been co-directed by Manju Borah and Dan Wolman

title: TMC MPs stage protest outside Home Ministry office over raids on I-PAC, detained
content: TMC MPs O'Brien, Satabdi Roy, Mahua Moitra, Bapi Haldar, Saket Gokhale, Pratima Mondal, Kirti Azad and Sharmila Sarkar were among those who took part in the protest.

title: Trade unions must unite to counter anti-worker policies, says Elamaram Kareem
content: Elamaram Kareem, recently elected general secretary of CITU, emphasises trade union unity to combat ‚Äòanti-worker policies‚Äô and protect workers‚Äô rights amid evolving labour challenges. He says all organisations, including BMS, are welcome to join collective action against Union government‚Äôs such policies

title: Jaishankar meets French President Macron, appreciates 'positive sentiments' for strategic partnership
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar, who is on a six-day visit to France and Luxembourg, also addressed the Ambassadors‚Äô Conference of France on January 8, 2026

title: Calibrated capitulation: Congress claims govt planning to lift curbs on Chinese firms bidding for Indian contracts
content: Opposition party also demanded that Prime Minister Narendra Modi must explain his Government's sudden "U-turns" on China policy during the forthcoming Budget Session of Parliament

title: India participates in border coordination meet ahead of Nepal elections
content: The purpose of the meet is to ensure peace, security and administrative coordination along the International Border in view of upcoming elections in Nepal

title: Parties abandoning ideologies, poaching leaders through money, muscle and fear: Ajit Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar alleged that some leaders are being poached through inducements, while others are pressured by highlighting pending inquiries against them and assuring that probe agencies would be managed after a switch

title: ‚ÄòBhrasht Janata Party‚Äô: Rahul slams BJP's double engine govts in various States
content: Rahul Gandhi cited the murder of Ankita Bhandari in Uttarakhand, the Unnao rape case in Uttar Pradesh, deaths from drinking contaminated water in Indore, among others, to attack the BJP

title: ‚ÄòJana Nayagan‚Äô censor row: Madras High Court orders to grant U/A certificate to Vijay-starrer, CBFC files appeal
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan agree to consider a request made on behalf of the CBFC for an urgent hearing of the appeal against Justice P.T. Asha‚Äôs order

title: Justice Mahesh Sharadchandra Sonak sworn in as Chief Justice of Jharkhand High Court
content: Chief Minister Hemant Soren, Chief Secretary Avinash Kumar and other senior officials were present on the occasion.

title: India-U.S. trade deal didn‚Äôt happen because Modi did not call Trump: Lutnick
content: Howard Lutnick‚Äôs remarks came a few days after Mr. Trump said that Mr. Modi knew he was unhappy with India's purchases of Russian oil and that Washington could raise tariffs on New Delhi "very quickly"

title: Nainar Nagenthran meets Palaniswami ahead of PM Modi‚Äôs visit to T.N.
content: ‚ÄúTalks have been cordial. We discussed the visit of the Prime Minister. We will (further) discuss whether the meeting will be in Chennai or Madurai,‚Äù Mr. Nagenthran told reporters after the meeting with Mr. Palaniswami

title: Cathlab¬†embolisation¬†performed on 13-year-old dog in Pune
content: A 13-year-old Labrador with severe anemia, low platelets, and large liver‚Äìspleen tumors underwent¬†cathlab-guided¬†embolisation¬†at a Pune clinic.¬†¬†

title: Delhi Police arrests another accused in Turkman Gate stone-pelting case
content: We have arrested Mohd Imran (36). Further investigation is underway. Security will remain tightened in the area, says Additional Commissioner of Police (Central) Nidhin Valsan

title: Land-for-jobs case: Delhi court frames charges against Lalu Prasad, others
content: The CBI filed chargesheets against Lalu Prasad, his wife and former Bihar Chief Minister Rabri Devi, their son Tejashwi Yadav and others in connection with the alleged scam

title: 6-day Sri Mailaralingeshwar annual festival in Mailapur in Yadgir district of Karnataka to begin on January 12
content: Deputy Commissioner Harshal Bhoyar directed officials to organise the annual fair peacefully and ensure that all basic facilities, including drinking water and makeshift toilets, are put in place for devotees

title: Lighter school bags, classrooms without ‚Äòbackbenchers‚Äô: Kerala‚Äôs new lesson plan
content: A draft report proposing a reduction in weight of school bags and creating classrooms without 'backbenchers' has been approved by State Curriculum Steering Committee, General Education Minister V. Sivankutty has said

title: CUK‚Äôs language lab emerges as key platform for strengthening English skills among rural students in Karnataka
content: Centre for English Language Teaching (CELT) follows a learner-centric and need-based approach, first identifying gaps in students‚Äô language skills and then preparing customised content with emphasis on grammar, vocabulary and core communication skills

title: TMC protest in Kolkata LIVE: Mamata Banerjee alleges ED raids at I-PAC office aimed at stealing TMC strategy
content: CM Banerjee lodged dual complaints against the ED in connection with raids conducted at the I-PAC office and its chief, Prateek Jain's, residence, in Salt Lake.

title: The Hindu Group signs MoU with RV Institute of Technology and Management in Bengaluru
content: Citing the ‚ÄòGo Change the World‚Äô motive, college Principal Nagashettappa Biradar emphasised carrying this vision forward by empowering students to enhance their communication and writing abilities

title: Malayalam Language Bill, 2025: What it proposes and why it has triggered opposition outside Kerala | Explained
content: In October, Kerala Assembly passed Malayalam Language Bill, establishing Malayalam as State‚Äôs sole official language for government, education, and commerce. The Bill, which awaits Governor‚Äôs assent, has faced opposition, especially from Karnataka govt, citing concerns for Kannada-speaking residents in Kasaragod. But Kerala Law Minister has argued that the Bill includes protections for linguistic minorities

title: Studio Green rushes to Madras High Court to get Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar released
content: The production house urges the court to modify its December 2025 order prohibiting the release of the movie without paying ‚Çπ21.78 crore

title: Now, vehicle owners needn‚Äôt take vehicles to RTA offices for registration
content: As per the new stipulation, vehicle buyers will no longer be required to take their new vehicles to RTOs for inspection as part of the registration process

title: Indian top IT firms set for another tepid quarter on weak U.S. demand, client spending
content: Brokerages expect the top six IT firms by revenue to post about 4% year-on-year revenue growth and a 5% rise in profit for the December quarter on average

title: High Court verdict in plea over Telangana DGP appointment today
content: On October 10, city-based social activist T. Dhangopal Rao filed a writ petition challenging the appointment of IPS officer B. Shivadhar Reddy as the State Director General of Police

title: Supreme Court sets aside A.P. HC order quashing FIRs filed by ACB
content: The apex court directs the accused public servants to cooperate for the speedy conclusion of the probe

title: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah urges Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to withdraw Malayalam Bhasha Bill 2025
content: The Karnataka Border Area Development Authority petitioned Kerala Government on Wednesday urging him to reject the bill; Karnataka government fears the bill have negative impact on Kannada speaking linguistic minority in Kerala

title: Pakistan to take up with India any development activity in violation of IWT: Foreign Office
content: Foreign Office spokesperson Tahir Andrabi also said that the IWT remains a binding international instrument and there is no provision for abeyance of the treaty

title: Telangana land owner on ground, not in official records
content: Decades-old Sada Bainamas ‚Äî informal, plain-paper land agreements ‚Äî have left over nine lakh farmers in Telangana without titles as procedural hurdles and record discrepancies stall regularisation under the Bhu Bharati Act, 2025. Small and marginal farmers are calling for Gram Sabha verifications and clearer rules to secure ownership and reduce disputes, report¬†M. Rajeev, P. Sridhar and P. Laxma Reddy

title: Chittoor poised for a white revolution
content: On the road to recovery from a severe setback it suffered years ago following the closure of the Cooperative Milk Producers‚Äô Union, Chittoor district's dairy sector is set for a big leap riding on the relentless efforts of small and marginal farmers who constitute the buik of its operations, and the multi-pronged strategy rolled out by the government may turn out to be the much-needed push to shift the gear, writes  K. Umashanker

title: Defence corridor will be set up in Jaggayyapeta: Vijayawada MP
content: State government has sanctioned ‚Çπ100 crore to provide a permanent solution to the woes related to drinking water supply in Jaggayyapeta town, says Sivanath

title: Despite ban, roosterfight arenas being set up for Sankranti festival
content: Cases will be booked under AP Gaming Act and Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act against those who organise roosterfights, says NTR District Collector

title: PM Modi chairs roundtable with AI startups ahead of February summit
content: The firms had qualified for the AI Impact Summit‚Äôs which sought submissions from AI firms that could lead real-world impact

content: In separate letters, Mr. Pradhan emphasised on adoption of a mechanised coal transportation system along with advanced dust suppression measures

title: Jharkhand BJP chief accuses Soren‚Äôs government of robbing the rights of tribals
content: Babulal Marandi demanded that the Jharkhand government should reconsider the declared rules, otherwise, the BJP will take the matter to the people‚Äôs court in every village

title: Women in Rajasthan‚Äôs Jalore, almost disconnected
content: A caste panchayat in Rajasthan‚Äôs Jalore district banned women‚Äôs access to smartphones, revoking the ban when faced with outrage. While the village heads said it was the women who demanded it because the children overused them, some women say it‚Äôs about control, finds Alisha Dutta

title: 13 youths from conflict-scarred Manipur get jobs in Japan
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla interacted with them before their departure to work in nursing, hospitality, manufacturing, and other sectors

content: Justice Suvra Ghosh, before whom the matters were mentioned, is likely to take them up for hearing on Friday (January 9)

title: ACB unearths ‚Äòscam‚Äô worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore in Rajasthan‚Äôs midday meal scheme
content: The ACB‚Äôs probe found that the officials associated with the scheme and CONFED allegedly changed rules in collusion to exclude eligible firms from the tender process and extended undue benefits to favoured companies

title: Umar Khalid is not my mentor, Sharjeel Imam tells Delhi court
content: He had never spoken to Mr. Khalid in the five years he spent at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), Mr. Imam‚Äôs counsel said on his behalf

title: Mizoram Cabinet is against extending Governor‚Äôs Rule in troubled tribal council
content: The council of ministers said there was no justification for extending Governor‚Äôs Rule for another six months

title: Tej Pratap‚Äôs invitation to NDA leaders for Dahi-Chura feast creates political ripples in Bihar
content: The occasion in Bihar is also seen as a political¬†event of clearing the differences and a table of negotiation in which political rivalry is settled down

title: Work on first government critical care block for tribals in Vellore nearing completion
content: The new facility, which costs ‚Çπ23.75 crore, also has a spacious out-patient ward with seating arrangements for 100 people

title: The long arm of law catches up with former Kerala Minister in evidence-tampering case
content: It took three decades for a case booked for criminal conspiracy and causing disappearance of evidence against a legislator in Kerala to be decided by a trial court. Sarath Babu George tracks the legal and investigative processes that culminated in the conviction and subsequent disqualification of Antony Raju

title: Grok Turns Off Image Creation Feature For Non-Payers After Deepfake Backlash
content: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has turned off its image creation feature for non-paying users following backlash over its use to create sexualized deepfakes of women and children.

title: "Cancer Research" Project In Madhya Pradesh Under Scanner Over Financial Irregularities
content: A government-approved research project that promised breakthroughs in treating serious diseases like cancer using Panchagavya, a mix of cow dung, cow urine and milk-based preparations, has come under a cloud in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Pawars Are Talking Again, And So Are Thackerays. Here's Why
content: Maharashtra's political landscape is witnessing unprecedented realignments as the state prepares for municipal corporation elections across 29 bodies, a poll that comes four years behind schedule.

title: Mamata Banerjee Leads Rally, Judge Leaves Courtroom Amid I-PAC Raid Hearing
content: The face-off between the Centre and the West Bengal government over the Enforcement Directorate's raids on the Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) and its co-founder Pratik Jain escalated on Friday.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Oreshnik Missile That Travels At 10 Times Speed Of Sound
content: Russia attacked Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles overnight on Friday, officials said. The onslaught killed at least four people and injured 25 others in Kyiv.

title: On Camera: 2 Men On Scooter Assault Zepto Rider In Bengaluru After Collision
content: A delivery rider of the quick-commerce giant Zepto was assaulted by two men in Bengaluru on the night of January 4. The incident took place at around 8 pm near the 29th Cross Junction, Kaggadasapura.

title: From 'Peaceful' To Screams, Trinamool MPs Protest Outside Amit Shah Office
content: What began as a "peaceful protest" this morning, as claimed by Trinamool Congress MPs, in front of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's office in the national capital quickly changed into shouts and screams when the police moved in to clear them.

title: Body Of Man, Cut Into 3 Pieces, Found Inside Vacant Plot In Ludhiana: Cops
content: A dismembered body of a man was found in a vacant plot near a private school here on Thursday, police said.

title: 'Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam In Jail Due To Congress': Asaduddin Owaisi Explains
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has pinned the long jail stay of student activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam squarely on the Congress party.

title: "Shield Against Terror": Amit Shah Launches National IED Data System
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched the National IED Data Management System, a first of its kind digital platform aimed at strengthening Indias fight against improvised explosive device threats.

title: Stepmother Burns Child's Private Parts With Hot Spatula For Bedwetting In Kerala: Cops
content: A five-year-old girl's private parts were allegedly injured with a hot steel spatula by her stepmother for bedwetting, police said here on Friday.

title: South Korea's Yoon Faces Potential Death Penalty Over Martial Law Crisis
content: South Korea's special prosecutor is expected to make a sentencing request for former president Yoon Suk Yeol on charges of insurrection over his brief imposition of martial law in 2024, as a lower court trial convened on Friday for its final session.

title: Probe Agency ED Flags Alleged Goa Election Link In I-PAC Raids In Kolkata
content: The Enforcement Directorate's (ED) ongoing investigation into an alleged coal smuggling syndicate has brought to light a possible connection with election-related activities in Goa, sources told NDTV.

title: German Chancellor To Visit India From January 12-13 On PM Modi's Invite
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will meet the Federal Chancellor of Germany, Friedrich Merz on January 12 in Ahmedabad, an official statement by the Prime Minister's Office said.

title: "Workers Of Both NCPs Want To Unite, Family Tensions Sorted": Ajit Pawar
content: The workers of NCP's two factions want to unite and all tensions within the Pawar family have been resolved, Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar has told NDTV in an exclusive interview

title: Man Visits Commissioner Office To File Complaint, Steals Policeman's Bike
content: A man who visited the Thiruvananthapuram City Police Commissioner's office to lodge a complaint, allegedly walked out and rode off on a police officer's motorcycle.

title: Srinagar Sees Season's Coldest Night At -6 Degrees Celsius
content: On Thursday, Srinagar recorded its coldest night of the season at minus 6 degrees Celsius as Jammu and Kashmir continues to be under the grip of an intense cold wave.

title: US Man Arrested For Stealing 100 Sets Of Human Remains From Cemetery
content: Bones and skulls visible in the back seat of a car near an abandoned cemetery on Philadelphia's outskirts led police to a basement filled with body parts, which authorities say were hoarded by a man now accused of stealing 100 sets of human remains

title: Ex-Madhya Pradesh Minister's Daughter Among 3 Killed In Indore Accident
content: The victims included Prerna Bachchan, daughter of former Home Minister Bala Bachchan, and Prakhar Kasliwal, son of Congress state spokesperson Anand Kasliwal.

title: Gifted Dogs Learn Language By Eavesdropping: Study
content: There's a few special words that will perk the ears of many a dog -- hungry, park, and of course T-R-E-A-T. But a choice group of gifted canines appear to have remarkable capacity for learning human vocabulary, to the point that they acquire language

title: 'Excellent in everything': Why Man City moved fast to sign Semenyo
content: Antoine Semenyo speaks for the first time after signing for Manchester City from Bournemouth . the 19-year-old has been at the forefront of January transfer talk again . he has signed for the club for ¬£65 million (¬£62 million)

title: Trump pulls US out of India-led solar alliance, key climate pact
content: pullout is from all major climate-linked global bodies . withdrawal from ISA will not affect alliance's key goal . move comes as surprise as the Trump administration had never hinted at it after withdrawing from the Paris agreement .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Fudd, Strong headline women's Wooden Award midseason top 25
content: the wooden award is given to the most outstanding player in college basketball . azzi Fudd and Sarah Strong also return to the top-25 list . other notable inclusions include the likes of miLaysia Fulwiley, flau'jae Johnson and mikaylah Williams .

title: Premier League midseason awards: Best player, manager, more
